results.title: Ride in the whirlwind
results.creator_credit: Proteus Films, Jack Nicholson and Monte Hellman
results.brief_description: When three innocent cowboys are mistaken for stagecoach robbers, they are forced to become fugitives until they clear themselves of suspicion. Before Jack Nicholson achieved fame in “Easy Rider”, his electrifying talent was evident as the writer, co-producer and star of this taut, highly charged western thriller. Co-starring Cameron Mitchell, Millie Perkins and Harry Dean Stanton.

results.title: Richard III
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions and Laurence Olivier
results.brief_description: Richard III is the story of one man’s unbridled lust for the crown. Richard’s ambition leaves all who oppose him dead, pawns in his ruthless bid for the throne. This is a majestic film in every sense of the word, and one of the greatest films ever produced in England. Directed by, and starring, Laurence Olivier with Ralph Richardson, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud.

results.title: Rich and strange = East of Shanghai
results.creator_credit: British International Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: After coming into a small inheritance, a suburban couple, bored with life’s routine, seek a taste of the high life and excitement by going on a world cruise. One of Hitchcock’s personal favourites, the film is a sad/comic reflection upon marriage and the lives of ordinary people thrown into chaos. Stars Henry kendal and Joan Barry.

results.title: Revolution
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Goldcrest, Viking, Irwin Winkler and Hugh Hudson
results.brief_description: The personal story of Tom Dobb, a reluctant soldier in the American Revolution, his son Ned and the renegade aristocrat Daisy McConnahay is set against the larger backdrop of the American Revolution and what it has come to mean. Stars Al Pacino, Nastassia Kinski and Donald Sutherland with Joan Plowright and Annie Lennox.

results.title: Return to Oz
results.creator_credit: Oz Productions, Paul Maslansky and Walter Murch
results.brief_description: Based on L. Frank Baum’s two follow-up books to The Wizard of Oz, “Return to Oz” is not quite the frolicking musical fantasy of the original family film and it may prove a bit too scary for the younger viewer. Dorothy (Fairuza Balk), since returning home from the Land of Oz, cannot clear her head of the wonderful adventures and amazing characters she had come to know and love. Auntie Em, determined to rid Dorothy of all this Oz nonsense, sends her off for psychiatric treatment at a sanitarium. However, Dorothy is rescued by a mysterious girl and just as mysteriously ends up back in the Land of Oz where all is not as it was and the magical fantasy begins to turn into a nightmare adventure. Cast includes Nicol Williamson, Jean Marsh, Piper Laurie, Matt Clark. Parental guidance recommended.

results.title: Return from Witch Mountain
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ron Miller, Jerome Courtland and John Hough
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Escape to Witch Mountain” this family film is full of adventure and fantasy as Tia (Kim Richards) and her brother Tony (Ike Eisenmann), both who have supernatural powers, arrive on Planet Earth for a holiday. Dr Gannon (Christopher Lee) and his offsider Letha (Bette Davis) are trying to develop a mind-control device and when the evil Dr Gannon learns of Tony’s special powers, he kidnaps him, leaving it to Tia with her telepathic powers, and a motley gang of youngsters, to rescue Tony.

results.title: Restoration
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Cary Brokaw, Andy Paterson, Sarah Ryan Black and Michael Hoffman
results.brief_description: Restoration is a lavish costume drama which follows the story of Robert Merivel (Robert Downey Jr.)a young doctor whose life is changed when he is favoured by King Charles II (Sam Neill). Amidst the decadent opulance of the Restoration court Merivel soon loses sight of his career as a doctor but when he is abandoned by Charles he must return to poverty and find a place in the real world again. Based on the novel by Rose Tremain, Michael Hoffman’s film gives a great sense of life in England during the Restoration period. Sam Neill is excellent as the capricious King and Robert Downey Jr. likeable as the wayward Merivel. With appearances by Meg Ryan, Hugh Grant, Polly Walker, David Thewlis and Ian Mackellan and gorgeous music by Henry Purcell. Winner of 1996 Academy Awards for best Art Direction and Best Costume Design.

details.label: Subject categories

results.title: Repo man
results.creator_credit: Michael Nesmith Productions, Edge City Productions, Jonathan Wacks, Peter McCarthy and Alex Cox
results.brief_description: A groundbreaking movie that introduced a punk sensibility to the film noir genre. Otto (Emilio Estevez) is a bored young man, just fired from his job in a supermarket, who meets up with a smooth-talking loner (Harry Dean Stanton) who recruits him as a “repo man”: a repossesor of cars because of default of payment. The strange plot involves aliens, Government spies and assorted punks and gangsters all searching for a 1964 Chevy Malibu which may hold the secret of life and death. The plot, however, doesn’t really matter. What does is the assured surreal landscape that Alex Cox discovers in the underbelly of suburban Los Angeles, and his irreverent experiments with genre. The LA of Repo Man is a disintegrating city, violent and alienated, but the film manages to undiscover a weird and sometimes eloquent beauty in the decay. The soundtrack, featuring US independant punk music from bands like Circle Jerks, Suicidal Tendencies, Black Flag and Iggy Pop is outstanding.

results.title: Regarding Henry
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Scott Rudin and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: Harrison Ford stars as Henry Turner, a successful but ruthless New York lawyer who must win at any cost, even at the expense of his family. A single, freakish gunshot brings Henry’s world crashing down as he is left incapacitated and with no memory of the life he used to lead. Now, faced with starting over, Henry will learn the painful truth about his life and rediscover the family he never really had. Also starring Annette Bening as Henry’s long-suffering wife, this thought provoking film questions the importance of money over family and ultimately - the price of happiness.

results.title: Reform school girl
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP), Robert J. Gurney, Samuel Z Arkoff and Edward Bernds
results.brief_description: Aimed at a teenage audience, “Reform school girl” is a redemptive tale about a mixed-up teenager, Donna Price, who after her involvement in a fatal car crash, is shipped off to reform school. There she is witness to the out-of-kilter lives of wayward girls and she recognises her choice between revealing the truth of the night of the crash, and perishing behind bars. At times this B-movie juvenile-delinquency drama is quite gritty and sordid, dealing with the themes of incest, manipulation and moral corruption.
